summary: This is an email from a paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY to FBI and NYPD contacts, transmitting a zip file containing exhibits pertaining to Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application. It demonstrates coordination between federal and local law enforcement on the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Amanda N. Youn
persons.context: FBI agent who is a recipient of the email containing Maxwell's bail application exhibits.

persons.name: M Byrne
persons.context: NYPD contact who is a recipient of the email containing Maxwell's bail application exhibits.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the renewed bail application whose exhibits are being transmitted in the attached zip file.

connections.description: Both are recipients of the same email from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Maxwell case, indicating coordination between FBI and NYPD.
Youn, as an FBI agent, is receiving case materials related to Maxwell's bail application as part of the investigation.
Byrne, as an NYPD contact, is receiving case materials related to Maxwell's bail application, indicating NYPD involvement or interest in the case.

events.title: Maxwell's Renewed Bail Application Filed
events.description: The defense filed a renewed motion for bail for Ghislaine Maxwell, with accompanying exhibits.

events.title: Transmission of Bail Exhibits to Law Enforcement
events.description: A paralegal specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office emailed the exhibits from Maxwell's renewed bail application to FBI and NYPD contacts.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: On December 9, 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY transmitted exhibits related to Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed bail application to FBI and NYPD contacts.
The communication shows active coordination between federal prosecutors (SDNY), the FBI, and the NYPD regarding the Maxwell case.
The attached file was named '2020-12-08_defense_renewed_motionfor_bail.zip', indicating the bail motion was filed on December 8, 2020.
The correspondence originated from a Paralegal Specialist at the U.S. Attorney's Office, demonstrating routine procedural sharing of court filings with law enforcement partners.
